data.title: TRAITOR TO THE LIVING
data.meta_description: New York: Ballantine Books, 1973 . Small octavo, pictorial wrappers. First edition. Ballantine Books 23613. Imaginative SF thriller in which a dead man takes control of a machine that can communicate with the dead and kills people connected with its invention to cover his tracks. Classic Farmer combination of sex, violence, paranoia, and corruptible human nature. A fine copy. #87933
data.text:
Farmer, Philip Jose. TRAITOR TO THE LIVING. New York: Ballantine Books, [1973]. Small octavo, pictorial wrappers. First edition. Ballantine Books 23613. Imaginative SF thriller in which a dead man takes control of a machine that can communicate with the dead and kills people connected with its invention to cover his tracks. Classic Farmer combination of sex, violence, paranoia, and corruptible human nature. A fine copy. (#87933).

Price: $25.00
